title: dataloader parallels over elements vs over batches
body_html: With current design of dataloader, if we set num_workers=8, 8 batches of data will be prepared in advance, each worker works on one batch. This is not very efficient especially when one batch is large/expensive to process; and normally we only need 1-2 batches ahead of time . Why didn't we go with the design where all workers work on one batch at a time?
body_text: With current design of dataloader, if we set num_workers=8, 8 batches of data will be prepared in advance, each worker works on one batch. This is not very efficient especially when one batch is large/expensive to process; and normally we only need 1-2 batches ahead of time . Why didn't we go with the design where all workers work on one batch at a time?
body: With current design of `dataloader`, if we set `num_workers=8`, 8 batches of data will be prepared in advance, each worker works on one batch. This is not very efficient especially when one batch is large/expensive to process; and normally we only need 1-2 batches ahead of time . Why didn't we go with the design where all workers work on one batch at a time?
